item.dc:creator: Melissa Lewis

item.title: Jupyter + Pandas for an intuitive, beginner-friendly data analysis workflow
item.description:
Description

In this talk I'd walk through what I think are the best features of Jupyter (like magic methods, multimedia, several options for markup language, built-in documentation) and the best features of Pandas (powerful I/O, intelligent treatment of datetime) and analyze a public dataset. In this way I'd demonstrate that, as is typical of Python efforts, this is an extraordinarily lucid and beginner-friendly way to do data analysis in an open, replicable way.

"I'll also make the notebook and dataset available in advance of the talk so people can follow along. "

  • Melissa Lewi
item.dc:creator: Melissa Lewis

item.title: introduction to open and collaborative data analysis with pandas and IPython/Jupyter Notebook
item.description:
Description

Data munging is typically an involved and noisy process, but pandas -- especially using the notebook format -- make it easy to share and reproduce the process of analyzing data, from munging to analysis and even exploratory visualization! In this talk you'll get a glimpse of the pandas workflow and some tips for getting the most out of its use in the IPython/Jupyter notebook.
item.dc:creator: Melissa Lewis
